summary: Zaire, now known as the Democratic Republic of the Congo, was a large African country from 1971 to 1997. It was led by Mobutu Sese Seko, who took power in a coup. Zaire was an important country during the Cold War but faced many challenges, including corruption and economic issues. After Mobutu's rule ended, the country's name was changed back to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. This period was marked by political turmoil and regional conflicts, including the aftermath of the Rwandan genocide.
title: Zaire
